intro: Arthrostylis planiculmis, commonly known as the flat-leaf sword fern, is a species of fern native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its slender, arching fronds that are typically 30–60 cm in length. The plant has a short, creeping rhizome and produces sporangia on the underside of its fertile fronds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky crevices. The leaves are simple, with a smooth, flat surface and a delicate, feathery appearance.
